title: get broke reporting on 'notneeded' subdatasets in 0.12.0rc6

labels.name: fix-implemented
labels.description: A fix is available, but has not been merged or released, yet.

body:
Installing an already existing subdataset used to yield a "notneeded" result (as `get` does). With 0.12.0rc6 there's no result at all (which as a result breaks datalad-neuroimaging test helper for example dicom datasets:

```
❱ datalad create some
[INFO   ] Creating a new annex repo at /tmp/some
create(ok): /tmp/some (dataset)                                                                                              
(hirni-test-rc6) bpoldrack@brainbfast in /tmp
❱ cd some
(hirni-test-rc6) bpoldrack@brainbfast in /tmp/some on git:master
❱ datalad create -d . nested
[INFO   ] Creating a new annex repo at /tmp/some/nested
create(ok): nested (dataset)                                                                                                 
action summary:
  add (ok: 2)
  create (ok: 1)
  save (ok: 1)
(hirni-test-rc6) bpoldrack@brainbfast in /tmp/some on git:master
❱ datalad status
(hirni-test-rc6) bpoldrack@brainbfast in /tmp/some on git:master
❱ datalad -f json_pp get nested
{
  "action": "get",
  "path": "/tmp/some/nested",
  "refds": "/tmp/some",
  "status": "notneeded",
  "type": "directory"
}
(hirni-test-rc6) bpoldrack@brainbfast in /tmp/some on git:master
❱ datalad -f json_pp install nested
(hirni-test-rc6) bpoldrack@brainbfast in /tmp/some on git:master
❱
```

From the diff of `install` itself the change seems to be not in there, which suggests it's actually `get`. However, `get` does yield the correct result, so I'm not yet clear, where it goes wrong. Does that ring a bell, @mih?
